name: Young Foodies
slogan: A community and growth services for exciting food and drink startups
description:
We've built a community of over 800 challenger food and drink startup, giving them a peer network, regular events, blog content and an online forum portal to collaborate and support each other.

Members of the Young Foodies community have access to our value-add solutions. These have been built in collaboration with our members, making them completely tailored to small FMCG brands.

Our services include:

- Talent sourcing
- Consultants & contractor introductions
- Outsourced logistics
- Operations auditing
- Operations project work
- Packaging compliance & label checks
- Syndicated & solus field marketing
- Legal advisory

And lots more…

jobs.title: Talent Manager
jobs.description:
We are looking for an experienced recruiter to join the Talent team in finding superstars for our brands, with ambitious plans for the Talent team.

This person must be able to not only identify and land awesome people in roles at brands in our community, but also think holistically about how to make our Talent division the best in the industry. This is an opportunity for an ambitious recruiter to not only make a name for themselves in the world of FMCG start-up talent, but form part of an entrepreneurial mission led business that does much more than recruitment!

You will support on junior and senior roles across our Young Foodies brands.

The role itself will involve:

- Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from taking and shaping role briefings with brands, to supporting candidates in a recruitment process through to close
- Build consultative relationships and advise on the long-term hiring plans for our brands, so we continue to support their scaling in the right-way
- Be responsible for all clients giving the service a 5* review.
- Ensure the process of hiring for our clients and applicants is as simple as possible for all involved.
- Ensure we are always legally and reputationally protected for the work we do.
- Build strong relationships across the wider-industry to ensure we don’t miss out on any collaboration or candidate opportunities
- Communicate regularly to our talent pool to ensure they are always engaged

Must haves

- Experience exceeding targets in previous recruitment roles
- A passion for food & drink
- A ‘smart’ approach to managing your workload
- Excellent candidate attraction and management experience
- A very human and consultative approach to recruitment
- Excellent organisational skills

Nice to haves

- Experience in FMCG recruitment
- Experience especially in finance or sales role recruitment
- Experience of working in a start-up

Job Type: Full-time

Location: London

jobs.title: Operations Executive
jobs.description:
**OPERATIONS EXECUTIVE (HEALTHY SNACKING) (North London, £20-25K)**

This rapid-growth healthy snacking FMCG brand has big plans for 2020. They're at the forefront of the snacking revolution and are constantly innovating their brand, staying on top of consumer trends.

They are now looking for an excel whizz ready to hit the ground running as an Operations Executive, joining their innovative brand, working closely with the managing director to meet their growing demand!

Are you passionate about the FMCG industry? Love problem solving and making processes as efficient as possible? Excited by working in a startup environment? 

**The Role**

The Operations and Supply chain team follow the product journey from a customer order into the consumer’s hands, getting them on time and in full, is a fundamental part of their business. As a new business, they’re constantly learning, solving problems as they arise and focus on creating the systems and solutions across the business today that will form the foundation of their business as they grow. 

**Key Responsibilities**

Join a collaborative and focused brand, working together to make sure their supply chain is ship-shape and they’re doing a fantastic job for their customers.

Implement and enhance their supply chain logistics – anticipate and forecast customer needs and then work directly with their suppliers to make sure everything runs smoothly.

Inventory management – Help to ensure the systems and procedures they have in place are working properly and to always be aware of the available goods across all their ingredients and locations to identify and resolve any shortages before they’re ever an issue.

Customer fulfillment- work effectively to meet the varying needs of all our customers. That could be hitting a tight delivery slot or quickly coming up with solutions to meet the more challenging customer requests.

**The Person**

Strong problem-solving skills and numerical aptitude
A methodical thinker with high attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly growing environment
Positive, proactive and tenacious: things in the business can change very quickly, so being reactive to unexpected opportunities and challenges is key
Ability and interest to work cross-functionally, be ready to roll up their sleeves and carry out tasks away from their core focus
Honesty & integrity- a conviction in their work to improve their small patch of the world for themselves and others
Be a team player

**The Package**

A competitive salary
Rapid growth opportunities to take a step up in the role quickly
22 days paid holiday plus bank holidays
Flexible working hours- they believe in ensuring work-life balance!

jobs.title: Grocery National Account Manager
jobs.description:
**GROCERY NATIONAL ACCOUNT MANAGER (£40-50k, South London)   **        

**COMPANY OVERVIEW**

Young Foodies are looking for a Grocery National Account Manager to join in on the exciting journey of one of our brands with a real passion for Regional European Food. The business was founded in 2009 and since then they have developed a large range of products - all with exceptional quality, a high shelf presence and a forward thinking strategy around NPD. They are a team of approx. 15 people based out of a spacious open plan office in South London.

**ROLE & RESPONSIBILTIES**

•	Manage the day to day relationships with existing Grocery accounts (including Waitrose, Ocado & Sainsbury’s)
•	Create and execute sales strategies to drive sustainable growth in those accounts.
•	Create, negotiate and implement profitable business plans with key accounts.
•	Effectively communicate across all levels via presentations & proposals
•	Deliver plans on time and on budget
•	Take a needs-based, category selling approach to growing revenue & market share
•	Forecast, implement and analyse promotional activity
•	Develop a deep understanding of each customer and identify opportunities.
•	Provide full service and sales support including resolving day-to-day issues.
•	Attend key customer meetings, conferences and events

**SKILLS & EXPERIENCE**

We’re looking for a commercial candidate with strong UK Grocery sales experience, ideally gained from blue chip or SME environments across food and beverage branded businesses. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and proactive go-getter, happy to take hold of their own progression and development within the business. 

You must be able to demonstrate:
•	Proven experience at National Account Executive Level in FMCG
•	Astute Commercial Skills including calculating promo funding and margins
•	Experience of managing a P&L
•	Experience interpreting and using IRI, Dunnhumby, Nielson data
•	Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint
•	Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
•	Strong negotiation skills
•	Knowledge of UK Grocery Retailers, Particularly ‘Big 4’
•	A natural relationship builder, collaborative and a sense of the wider team
•	High capacity for work and extra responsibility
•	Thrives under pressure and taking on challenges in a fast-paced environment
•	Experience of selling premium or healthy brands is desirable.

**REMUNERATION: **

•	Competitive salary £40k+
•	Bonus
•	Contributory pension**
